ratings.comment: If you're interested in learning, then she's you're in the right class.

Never more disappointed in a Spanish prof. Didn't follow her own syllabus or grading criteria - subjective, harsh grader. All around difficult to work with. Nice if you went in to ask questions, but was too demanding for this class. LEARN THE VOCAB. We didn't do anything helpful in class - all pointless busywork on our own. $150 Book used twice

Loved this class in the beginning, now hate it. Professor doesn't follow her own rules. Grading criteria for both journals and exams is completely made-up and changes depending on how she feels. Believes that because ALL of the students do poorly on tests, we don't care about school (even though we're all at least 4th years & all *pre-medicine*)...

We never know what will be on the exams. She copies & pastes random articles off health websites for us to translate, but that's not exactly good study material for what we learned in class. If you don't pick up your journal in time, you'll get a 0. She expects you to know everything but is not clear on expectations at all.

I did not work with her directly, only through a TA, Monica Styles. However, when I would email her as she was the course director, she would not do anything! her TAs had no uniformity among their grading techniques which really screwed over out class yet she never looked in to it, despite a class of 25 all emailing her the situation

the class I took with her was a medical spanish class and I feel like she demanded more from us than normal. She is very helpful and knows her stuff, but she requires a lot out of her students and will expect you to go above and beyond in order to get an A.

Not a good class to take during the summer. A lot is expected, from huge amounts of vocabulary to weekly reports, exams and oral presentations. Her teaching style is good enough, though some activities seemed a bit like overkill. Overall, this class pushes you and should greatly help with speaking, though it's quite the commitment.

If you know your spanish, this class is very easy. Gemrich is really nice, not spanish obviously, but still a good teacher and is very willing to help with your vocab in class. If you show any sort of interest and care for the class, she treats you well. If your spanish is just so-so do the work and you'll get at least a B. If it's good, easy A.

When she says learn the vocab, she means it. Learned that the hard way. Constantly learning vocab, but it's really useful and great for expansion. Informes were pretty easy, just had to do them to get credit. Presentations were pretty fun to do, and listen to. She really encourages the class to get to know each other.

I was scared****less of this lady at first! For first test, we had to learn close to 300 vocab words~however it was possilble!This class honestly helped me out so much and Gemrich really aided. I always had issues with grammar and concordanica and that doubt was eliminated this semester and it feels great! Shes a tough cookie but a great prof!!

Tons of vocabulary, especially during the summer. Manageable course - 3 exams, 3 presentations, and 3 informes of a page in length. Lots of group work to foster conversation. Great professor -she explains everything clearly and has a genuine interest in teaching the vocabulary - she uses a lot of it while teaching the course.  Would recommend her.

The class is titled "Advanced Conversation". Do not expect to be conversing. Tons of vocab and high school-like homework assignments. Her tests are all memorization and tricky. Thought I would like this class a lot more than I did.
Great professor.  There is a LOT of vocab but the difficulty of the class is not high.  She does give pop quizzes and is usually about 5 minutes late to class

Great prof. This class has a ridiculous amount of vocab (160+ new words a week) and there are pop quizzes almost every day, but you really learn the material and I did increase my fluidity of speaking. The tests can be rough, but there are lots of ways to earn points. I'd certainly recommend this class if you can get in it, which is hard.
By-the-numbers workbook-style Spanish.  She's really nice and going to her office is worthwhile.
